description.narrative: 1. Project: 11516 Right to Peace programme in Central African Republic (CAR)#2. Project area and Country: Countrywide, Central African Republic (CAR)#3. Project justification:#According to OCHA 2018 CAR humanitarian plan, the government is not in control o f a majority of the national territory. Official structures also lack the capacity to implement the reconciliation agenda. FCA has been implementing the Right to Peace (R2P) programme In CAR since 2013, with the main objective of advancing reconciliation a nd mediation, focusing on working with the local peace committees. #The start of the new programme period 2018-2023 provides an excellent opportunity to assess FCAs earlier peace work and to discuss the successes and lessons learnt in order to promote sust ainable and impactful results. The rapidly changing context and needs require and justify a deeper analysis of the context in CAR, especially with regard the current conflict dynamics and promotion of sustainable peace.#4. The main objective and expected r esults:#The project will build on the lessons learnt from FCAs earlier R2P work in CAR and the results and recommendations of the assessments to be conducted in April-May 2018. The subsequent analysis will contribute to strengthen FCAs peace programming in CAR and to enhance its quality. The key activities for the first half of the year include the context analysis focused on FCA strategic lines (to be funded by FCA) and a thematic peace assessment that will provide the necessary knowledge and information f or the development of the follow-up peace project in CAR, due to start in June/July 2018. Once the multi-year peace project document and budget have been finalized, it will possible to also establish the 2018 work plan for the project. #5. Rights-holders /beneficiaries/duty-bearers: To be established once the new project plan has been finalised.#6. Implementing partner: This project is self-implemented by FCA CAR.
